column4: Hello, I've installed Ubuntu Server 10.04 LTS on a DL145 Server from an USB stick, the installation process goes through fine, but now when I try and boot, it just shows BIOS info etc etc and then gets to a black screen with a blinking cursor.
If you use Ctrl + F2, do you get a terminal?
no i dont.. I suspect there is a problem with grub, pressing shift during startup doesnt do anything either
Checked the install image and HDD for errors? Also, if you boot to a live environment, what can you determine about the installed OS?
yes, the md5 sum is correct.. so is the hdd..

Im during the installation process again, it gets to where I can create partitions etc.. the drive on which I want to create the partition for ubuntu server is called "SDB" and the USB Flash Drive is SDA.. Does this do a difference?
That is kinda of odd, but shouldn't break the system. Confirm that the installer installs to the HDD and not the USB?
That's confirmed.. I did a manually partitioning..
the setup looks similar to this: http://ubuntuforums.org/attachment.php?attachmentid=203602&d=1317836480
except it says: SCSCI 6 SDB
Is this in vbox or on a real machine?
it is a real machine.. HP ProLiant DL145 Server
Just to rule out the basics; Ctrl + F2/3/4/5/etc. get no shell, and the USB drive is disconnected, and Shift on boot does not get you a GRUB menu, and you are sure the BIOS boots to the right drive?
Youre correct. yea im quite sure..
If you get no shell and Shift doesn't work, it sounds like you are GRUB-less.
thats what I though.. does it have anything to do that the USB is called SDA and the Drive is called SDB
It is within the realm of possibility that GRUB was installed to the wrong drive.
yea, but would it work when im installing on sdb instead of sda?
If GRUB somehow ended up on SDA instead of SDB, then if SDA is plugged in, it should boot
That said, I would boot a live image and see where GRUB was installed
i will give it one more try..then i will try with a live image..
sounds good
